title: IRSA releases 130,000 cusecs water
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 1 (APP):Indus River System Authority (IRSA) on Wednesday released 130,000 cusecs of water from various rim stations with inflow of 130,400 cusecs.
According to the data released by IRSA, Tarbela Dam has already attained its maximum conservation level of 1550.00 feet, which was 148.00 feet higher than the dead level of 1402.00 feet. Water inflow and outflow in the dam were recorded as 81,400 cusecs and 81,100 cusecs, respectively.
The water level in the River Jhelum at Mangla Dam was 1240:75 feet, which was 190.75 feet higher than its dead level of 1,050 feet. The inflow and outflow of water was recorded as 8,400 cusecs each respectively.
The release of water at Kalabagh, Taunsa, Guddu and Sukkur was recorded as 89,500, 91,300, 120,000, and 56,100 cusecs, respectively.
Similarly, from River Kabul, a total of 10,500 cusecs of water was released at Nowshera, and 17,200 cusecs were released from River Chenab at Marala.
